intro: Psychotria canaguensis, commonly known as the "Amazonian morning glory," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to blue flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, dark blue berries that contain toxic compounds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has been used in traditional medicine and spiritual practices by indigenous communities.
